channel.title: Enviormental Variable Issues
channel.description:
I'm currently trying to convert my client into a .jar file, but I keep getting this error. I was told it was because of something in the enviormental variables. I am currently running off of WindowsXP 2003, and I have the latest JDK installed.
Error: [IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/2urwktx.jpg[/img]
User Variable: [IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/15qae1d.jpg[/img]
System Variable: [IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/2qm3ymu.jpg[/img]
Can someone help me with this so I can finally get my client converted into a .jar file?

item.title: Enviormental Variable Issues
item.dc:creator: @tyyy9 tyyy9
item.description:
@tyyy9 wrote:

here just use this tutorial and do what it says to do in the Path and Classpath files: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=342685.0 it will be in the middle.

Read full topic

item.title: Enviormental Variable Issues
item.dc:creator: @mrpyro3 mrpyro3
item.description:
@mrpyro3 wrote:

[quote=“homerunhitta977, post:3, topic:407422”]When I run the Java EV program I get this error:

How do I fix that? :([/quote]
Read it? It’s saying you don’t have .Net Framework v2+ installed.

Read full topic

Can someone help me with this so I can finally get my client converted into a .jar file?[/quote] You need to have the Path and Classpath set, I recommend using Lin’s environmental setter http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,375681.0.html
